channel.title: Team on Avokado Project
channel.description: Recent content in Team on Avokado Project

item.title: Dmitry Voronin
item.description: With Avito since 2014, has been working on CI/CD in Android since 2016.

item.title: Eugene Matsyuk
item.description: Stands up at 5 every morning to works hard on development. Author of popular posts and presentations on development in Android, organizer of meetups, workshops, and academies. Author of the architecture CookBook. One of the authors of the Kaspresso framework. Believes that autotests are the future and the promised land.

item.title: Daniil Popov
item.description: Has been doing Android development since 2012. Currently working on the infrastructure of the Android project at Avito. Came here from Mail.ru and mobile development teaching at Technopark.

item.title: Egor Kurnikov
item.description: Has been doing Android development since 2016. Formerly, Android engineer at Yandex, Kaspresky, Sberbank. One of the developers of the Kaspresso framework.

item.title: Evgeny Krivobokov
item.description: Got into Android development back in 2013. Two years later he joined Avito. Gradually, he got more and more focused on platform development. Evegeny helped other engineers with common tools, app assembly. Since 2018, he has been working on testing and CI tools.

item.title: Ruslan Mingaliev
item.description: Has been developing apps for Android since 2013. Formerly, senior software engineer at Kaspersky. One of the authors of the Kaspresso framework, contributor to Avito Android Open Source.

item.title: Sergey Boishtyan
item.description: At Avito, works in a team responsible for CI infrastructure for Android apps. Writes Gradle plugins and a testing framework.
